item.title: Value Added Tax (VAT) has been implemented in Saudi Arabia
item.description:
In anticipation of the January 1, 2018 Value Added Tax (VAT) launch, the KSA General Authority for Zakat and Tax introduced a mobile app on December 30, 2017. This app provides key information about VAT and helps consumers verify VAT registration status of businesses. The app’s “check” function allows consumers to scan the barcode on a VAT registration certificate or enter the business’ Commercial Registration Number or 15-digit VAT identification number from an invoice to confirm registration...

item.title: The Hong Kong budget provides a significant boost to the commercial sector in various ways
item.description:

item.title: India no longer accepts high denomination notes in the current series
item.description:
India’s Reserve Bank (RBI) has decided to discontinue the use of 500 and 1,000 rupee notes. These notes ceased to be legal tender as of November 9, 2016. Consequently, ATMs and other cash transaction machines were shut down on November 9 and 10. However, bank branches and government treasuries remained open on November 10. This move was prompted by the difficulty in differentiating real banknotes from counterfeit ones. The surge in fake currency was negatively impacting the Indian economy...

item.title: The TINA ERP system is compatible with GCC VAT calculations
item.description:
Source: dcs plus. Graphic for the TINA travel ERP software. dcs plus, a Romanian company with a Dubai office, has announced that its TINA web-based travel ERP system now supports value-added tax (VAT) calculations for businesses operating in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) region. This development comes as GCC member states prepare to fully implement VAT based on a framework agreement from 2016. TINA streamlines business operations by collecting booking details from various sales channels and organizing them into standardized, automated workflows...
